register.description: Peripheral release details.

bitfield.description: Business unit
Module functional identifier
RTL revision
Major revision
Custom revision
Minor revision

register.description: Indicates the MMR configuration.

bitfield.description: Indicates present partitions

register.description: Generate interprocessor communication interrupt to MCU R5 core0.

bitfield.description: Read returns current value
Read returns 0

register.description: Generate interprocessor communication interrupt to MCU R5 core1.

bitfield.description: Read returns current value
Read returns 0

register.description: Generate interprocessor communication interrupt to DMSC.

bitfield.description: Read returns current value
Read returns 0

register.description: Acknowledge interprocessor communication interrupt to MCU R5 core0.

bitfield.description: Read returns current value
Read returns current value

register.description: Acknowledge interprocessor communication interrupt to MCU R5 core1.

bitfield.description: Read returns current value
Read returns current value

register.description: Acknowledge interprocessor communication interrupt to DMSC.

bitfield.description: Read returns current value
Read returns current value

register.description: MCU Ethernet MAC address lower 32-bits.

bitfield.description: 32 lsbs of MAC address

register.description: MCU Ethernet MAC address upper 16-bits.

bitfield.description: 16 msbs of MAC address

register.description: Lower 32-bits of Partition0 write lock key. This register must be written with the designated key value followed by a write to with its key value before write-protected Partition 0 registers can be written.

bitfield.description: Write the kick0 unlock value followed by the kick1 unlock value to unlock the write-protected Partition0 registers
Unlock status. When set indicates that the proper unlock sequence has been performed and the partition is unlocked for writing.

register.description: Upper 32-bits of Partition 0 write lock key. This register must be written with the designated key value after a write to with its key value before write-protected Partition 0 registers can be written.

bitfield.description: Write the kick1 unlock value after the kick0 unlock value to unlock the write-protected Partition0 registers

register.description: Shows the interupt status (before enabling) and allows setting of the interrupt status (for test).

bitfield.description: Lock violation occurred (attempt to write a write-locked register with partition locked)
Address violation occurred (attempt to read or write an invalid register address)
Protection violation occurred (attempt to to read or write a register with insufficient sucurity or privilege access rights)

register.description: Shows the enabled interrupt status and allows the interrupt to be cleared.

bitfield.description: Enabled lock interrupt event status
Enabled address interrupt event status
Enabled protection interrupt event status

register.description: Allows interrupt enables to be set.

bitfield.description: Lock interrupt enable
Address interrupt enable
Protection interrupt enable

register.description: Allows interrupt enables to be cleared.

bitfield.description: Lock interrupt disable
Address interrupt disable
Protection interrupt disable

register.description: Vector value This register should be written with interrupt distribution value required by the device architecture to indicate service completion of the MMR interrupt. The EOI register is used to re-trigger the pulse interrupt signal to ensure that any nested interrupt events are serviced. The software interrupt handler must write to the EOI register at the end of the current interrupt processing routine, so that new events can re-trigger the pulse interrupt signal again. For level interrupt signals the EOI register is not functional and must not be used.
Indicates the address of the first transfer that caused a fault to occur.

bitfield.description: Address of the faulted access

register.description: Indicates the access type of the first transfer that caused a fault to occur.

bitfield.description: Type of access which faulted 0h - No fault 1h - User execute access 2h - User write access 4h - User read access 8h - Supervisor execute access 10h - Supervisor write access 20h - Supervisor read access

register.description: Indicates the attributes of the first transfer that caused a fault to occur.

bitfield.description: Transaction ID
Route ID
Privilege ID

register.description: Allows software to clear the current fault. Clearing the current fault allows the , , and registers to latch the attributes of the next fault that occurs. This does not affect the fault interrupt event itself. The interrupt must be cleared using the appropriate INTR_STATUS_CLR register bits.

bitfield.description: Fault clear

register.description: Used to configure MSMC reset options.

bitfield.description: In the asymmetric interleave, controls which EMIF controller implements the separated range of the memory window
Defines the size of each memory stripe for interleaved memory space
Defines the memory window size for the interleaved region starting at the bottom of the external memory address range.
Disables MSMC SRAM initialization (Data, Cache Tags, and Snoop Filters). This is required for proper initial ECC initialization.
Reserved. Write 1h for compatibility. Do not write 0h.

register.description: Controls MCU Ethernet Port1 operation.

bitfield.description: Port1 RGMII internal transmit delay selection
Selects ethernet switch Port1 interface 0h - GMII/MII (not supported) 1h - RMII 2h - RGMII 3h - SGMII (not supported)

register.description: Controls if MCU_SPI1 is directly connected to SPI3 in the MAIN Domain (default) or if MCU_SPI1 and SPI3 are independently pinned out.

bitfield.description: Disables direct connection of MCU_SPI1 to SPI3 0h - MCU_SPI1 is tied as a slave to SPI3. MCU_SPI1 CLK, DATA1 and CS0 are driven from SPI3, DATA OUT drives SPI3 DATA0 1h - MCU_SPI1 is NOT tied as a slave to SPI3. MCU_SPI1 CLK, DATA0, DATA1 and CS[3:0] are controlled through their respective MCU_SPI1 pins and SPI3 CLK, DATA0, DATA1, and CS[3:0] are controlled through their respective SPI3 pins.

register.description: Controls MCU I3C0 operation.

bitfield.description: Manufacturer ID
Master Role

Provisional ID Instance. This input corresponds to bits[15:12] of the Provisional ID. It is intended to provide a way of differentiating several I3C devices if there would be no other way to have each manufactured device have a unique Provisional ID

register.description: Controls MCU I3C0 operation.

bitfield.description: Indicates the number of pclk cycles in the Bus Available condition
Indicates the number of pclk cycles in the Bus Idle condition

register.description: Controls MCU I3C1 operation.

bitfield.description: Manufacturer ID
Master Role

Provisional ID Instance. This input corresponds to bits[15:12] of the Provisional ID. It is intended to provide a way of differentiating several I3C devices if there would be no other way to have each manufactured device have a unique Provisional ID

register.description: Controls MCU I3C1 operation.

bitfield.description: Indicates the number of pclk cycles in the Bus Available condition
Indicates the number of pclk cycles in the Bus Idle condition

register.description: Controls MCU I2C0 operation.

bitfield.description: HS Mode master current source enable.

register.description: Controls Flash boot region size and placement.

bitfield.description: Selects the size of the boot block to be used for the S1 (OSPI1) flash interface

Selects the boot block to be used for the S1 (OSPI1) flash interface. If the s1_boot_size is 128 MB then only bits [4:0] of this field are used. Care must be taken to account for the address translation as to not fall off or wrap the address of the flash. (e.g. if both ECC and authentication are enabled for 64 MB boot, the highest valid block number is is 49, as sector 50 is only .2M Bytes in size.)
Selects the size of the boot block to be used for the S0 (OSPI0 or HyperBus) flash interface

Selects the boot block to be used for the S0 (OSPI0 or HyperBus) flash interface. If the s0_boot_size is 128 MB then only bits [4:0] of this field are used. Care must be taken to account for the address translation as to not fall off or wrap the address of the flash. (e.g. if both ECC and authentication are enabled for 64 MB boot, the highest valid block number is is 49, as sector 50 is only .2M Bytes in size.)

register.description: Controls operation of MCU ADC0.

bitfield.description: Enables MCU_ADC0 data pins to be used as general purpose inputs when set. This signal is tied to the en_dig_test input of MCU_ADC0

Selects the source of the ADC hardware event trigger 0h - MCU_ADC_EXT_TRIGGER0 pin 1h - MCU_ADC_EXT_TRIGGER1 pin 2h - eHRPWM SOCA event 3h - eHRPWM SOCB event 4h - MCU Timer0 PWM output 5h - MCU Timer1 PWM output 6h - MCU Timer2 PWM output 7h - MCU Timer3 PWM output 8h - Timer0 PWM output 9h - Timer1 PWM output Ah - Timer2 PWM output Bh - Timer3 PWM output Ch - Timer4 PWM output Dh - Timer5 PWM output Eh - Timer6 PWM output Fh - Timer7 PWM output 10h - Timer8 PWM output 11h - Timer9 PWM output 12h - Timer10 PWM output 13h - Timer11 PWM output 14h - ICSS-G0 IEP0 CMP15 event 15h - ICSS-G0 IEP1 CMP15 event 16h - ICSS-G1 IEP0 CMP15 event 17h - ICSS-G1 IEP1 CMP15 event 18h - MCU Timer4 PWM output 19h - MCU Timer5 PWM output 1Ah - MCU Timer6 PWM output 1Bh - MCU Timer7 PWM output 1Ch - MCU Timer8 PWM output 1Dh - MCU Timer9 PWM output 1Eh - Reserved (tied 0h) 1Fh - Reserved (tied 0h)

register.description: Controls operation of MCU ADC1.

bitfield.description: Enables MCU_ADC1 data pins to be used as general purpose inputs when set. This signal is tied to the en_dig_test input of MCU_ADC1

Selects the source of the ADC hardware event trigger 0h - MCU_ADC_EXT_TRIGGER0 pin 1h - MCU_ADC_EXT_TRIGGER1 pin 2h - eHRPWM SOCA event 3h - eHRPWM SOCB event 4h - MCU Timer0 PWM output 5h - MCU Timer1 PWM output 6h - MCU Timer2 PWM output 7h - MCU Timer3 PWM output 8h - Timer0 PWM output 9h - Timer1 PWM output Ah - Timer2 PWM output Bh - Timer3 PWM output Ch - Timer4 PWM output Dh - Timer5 PWM output Eh - Timer6 PWM output Fh - Timer7 PWM output 10h - Timer8 PWM output 11h - Timer9 PWM output 12h - Timer10 PWM output 13h - Timer11 PWM output 14h - ICSS-G0 IEP0 CMP15 event 15h - ICSS-G0 IEP1 CMP15 event 16h - ICSS-G1 IEP0 CMP15 event 17h - ICSS-G1 IEP1 CMP15 event 18h - MCU Timer4 PWM output 19h - MCU Timer5 PWM output 1Ah - MCU Timer6 PWM output 1Bh - MCU Timer7 PWM output 1Ch - MCU Timer8 PWM output 1Dh - MCU Timer9 PWM output 1Eh - Reserved (tied 0h) 1Fh - Reserved (tied 0h)

register.description: Controls MCU Timer0 operation.

bitfield.description: Selects the MCU_TIMERIO input pin for capture input signal. This control is only used when TIMER0 is configured for capture operation. 0h - Use MCU_TIMER_IO0 pin 1h - Use MCU_TIMER_IO1 pin 2h - Use MCU_TIMER_IO2 pin 3h - Use MCU_TIMER_IO3 pin 4h - Use MCU_TIMER_IO4 pin 5h - Use MCU_TIMER_IO5 pin 6h - Use MCU_TIMER_IO6 pin 7h - Use MCU_TIMER_IO7 pin 8h - Use MCU_TIMER_IO8 pin 9h - Use MCU_TIMER_IO9 pin

bitfield.description: When set, enables cascading of MCU_TIMER1 to MCU_TIMER0

bitfield.description: Selects the source of the MCU_TIMERIO0 output 0h - MCU_TIMERIO0 is driven by MCU_TIMER0 output 1h - MCU_TIMERIO0 is driven by MCU_TIMER1 output 2h - MCU_TIMERIO0 is driven by MCU_TIMER2 output 3h - MCU_TIMERIO0 is driven by MCU_TIMER3 output 4h - MCU_TIMERIO0 is driven by MCU_TIMER4 output 5h - MCU_TIMERIO0 is driven by MCU_TIMER5 output 6h - MCU_TIMERIO0 is driven by MCU_TIMER6 output 7h - MCU_TIMERIO0 is driven by MCU_TIMER7 output 8h - MCU_TIMERIO0 is driven by MCU_TIMER8 output 9h - MCU_TIMERIO0 is driven by MCU_TIMER9 output Ah - MCU_TIMERIO0 is driven low Bh - MCU_TIMERIO0 is driven high Ch - MCU_TIMERIO0 is driven low Dh - MCU_TIMERIO0 is driven high Eh - MCU_TIMERIO0 is driven low Fh - MCU_TIMERIO0 is driven high

register.description: Controls MCU TimerIO muxing.

bitfield.description: Selects the source of the MCU_TIMERIO1 output 0h - MCU_TIMERIO1 is driven by MCU_TIMER0 output 1h - MCU_TIMERIO1 is driven by MCU_TIMER1 output 2h - MCU_TIMERIO1 is driven by MCU_TIMER2 output 3h - MCU_TIMERIO1 is driven by MCU_TIMER3 output 4h - MCU_TIMERIO1 is driven by MCU_TIMER4 output 5h - MCU_TIMERIO1 is driven by MCU_TIMER5 output 6h - MCU_TIMERIO1 is driven by MCU_TIMER6 output 7h - MCU_TIMERIO1 is driven by MCU_TIMER7 output 8h - MCU_TIMERIO1 is driven by MCU_TIMER8 output 9h - MCU_TIMERIO1 is driven by MCU_TIMER9 output Ah - MCU_TIMERIO1 is driven low Bh - MCU_TIMERIO1 is driven high Ch - MCU_TIMERIO1 is driven low Dh - MCU_TIMERIO1 is driven high Eh - MCU_TIMERIO1 is driven low Fh - MCU_TIMERIO1 is driven high

register.description: Lower 32-bits of Partition1 write lock key. This register must be written with the designated key value followed by a write to with its key value before write-protected Partition 1 registers can be written.

bitfield.description: Write the kick0 unlock value followed by the kick1 unlock value to unlock the write-protected Partition1 registers
Unlock status. When set indicates that the proper unlock sequence has been performed and the partition is unlocked for writing.

register.description: Upper 32-bits of Partition 1 write lock key. This register must be written with the designated key value after a write to with its key value before write-protected Partition 1 registers can be written.

bitfield.description: Write the kick1 unlock value after the kick0 unlock value to unlock the write-protected Partition1 registers

register.description: Enables and selects clock source of CPSW MCU_CLKOUT0 pin.

bitfield.description: When set, enables MCU_CLKOUT0 output
Selects MCU_CLKOUT0 clock source

register.description: Selects the functional clock source for the MCU domain eFuse Controller.

bitfield.description: Selects the clock source 0h - EFUSE_CLK (WKUP_HFOSC0_CLKOUT or CLK_12M_RC) 1h - MCU_SYSCLK0 / 8

register.description: Controls the functional clock source for MCU_MCAN0.

bitfield.description: MCU_MCAN MCAN_CLK selection

register.description: Controls the functional clock source for MCU_MCAN1.

bitfield.description: MCU_MCAN MCAN_CLK selection

register.description: Controls the OSPI loopback clock source.

bitfield.description: OBSPI0 Loopback clock source
OSPI0 reference clock selection

register.description: Controls the OSPI loopback clock source.

bitfield.description: OBSPI1 Loopback clock source
OSPI1 reference clock selection

register.description: Controls the functional clock source for the MCU_ADC0.

bitfield.description: Selects the sampling clock source for ADC0 0h - WKUP_HFOSC0_CLKOUT 1h - MCU_PLL1_HSDIV1_CLKOUT1 2h - MCU_PLL0_HSDIV1_CLKOUT1 3h - MCU_EXT_REFCLK0

register.description: Controls the functional clock source for the MCU_ADC1.

bitfield.description: Selects the sampling clock source for ADC1 0h - WKUP_HFOSC0_CLKOUT 1h - MCU_PLL1_HSDIV1_CLKOUT1 2h - MCU_PLL0_HSDIV1_CLKOUT1 3h - MCU_EXT_REFCLK0

register.description: Controls selectable clock sources for the MCU Ethernet Port1.

bitfield.description: Selects the clock source for the CPSW2x Ethernet switch Common Platform Time Stamp module 0h - MAIN_PLL3_HSDIV1_CLKOUT 1h - MAIN_PLL0_HSDIV6_CLKOUT 2h - MCU_CPTS_REF_CLK (pin) 3h - CPTS_RFT_CLK (pin) 4h - MCU_EXT_REFCLK0 (pin) 5h - EXT_REFCLK1 (pin) 6h - SERDES0_IP2_LN0_TXMCLK 7h - SERDES0_IP2_LN1_TXMCLK 8h - SERDES1_IP2_LN0_TXMCLK 9h - SERDES1_IP2_LN1_TXMCLK Ah - SERDES2_IP2_LN0_TXMCLK Bh - SERDES2_IP2_LN1_TXMCLK Ch - SERDES3_IP2_LN0_TXMCLK Dh - SERDES3_IP2_LN1_TXMCLK Eh - MCU_PLL2_HSDIV1_CLKOUT Fh - MCU_PLL2_HSDIV1_CLKOUT
Selects the rmii clock (rmii_mhz_50_clk) source. This defaults to the internal 50 MHz clock source for proper clockstop operation

register.description: MCU Core 0 functional clock selection control.

bitfield.description: Selects the Core 0 functional clock and mcu/interface clock ratio

register.description: MCU Timer0 functional clock selection control.

bitfield.description: Timer functional clock input select mux control 0h - WKUP_HFOSC0_CLKOUT 1h - MCU_SYSCLK0 / 4 2h - CLK_12M_RC 3h - MCU_PLL2_HSDIV2_CLKOUT 4h - MCU_EXT_REFCLK0 5h - LPXOSC_CLKOUT 6h - CPSW_GENF0 7h - CLK_32K

register.description: MCU RTI0 functional clock selection control.

bitfield.description: When set, locks further writes to
RTI functional clock input select mux control 0h - WKUP_HFOSC0_CLKOUT 1h - LPXOSC_CLKOUT 2h - CLK_12M_RC 3h - CLK_32K

register.description: MCU RTI1 functional clock selection control.

bitfield.description: When set, locks further writes to
RTI functional clock input select mux control 0h - WKUP_HFOSC0_CLKOUT 1h - LPXOSC_CLKOUT 2h - CLK_12M_RC 3h - CLK_32K

register.description: Controls the functional clock source for MCU_USART0.

bitfield.description: MCU_USART0 FCLK selection

register.description: Lower 32-bits of Partition2 write lock key. This register must be written with the designated key value followed by a write to with its key value before write-protected Partition 2 registers can be written.

bitfield.description: Write the kick0 unlock value followed by the kick1 unlock value to unlock the write-protected Partition2 registers
Unlock status. When set indicates that the proper unlock sequence has been performed and the partition is unlocked for writing.

register.description: Upper 32-bits of Partition 2 write lock key. This register must be written with the designated key value after a write to with its key value before write-protected Partition 2 registers can be written.

bitfield.description: Write the kick1 unlock value after the kick0 unlock value to unlock the write-protected Partition2 registers

register.description: Configures and enables LBIST operation.

bitfield.description: Reset LBIST macro
Starts LBIST if all bits are 1
Runbist mode enable if all bits are 1
Clock delay after scan_enable switching
Loads LBIST clock divide ratio on transition from 0 to 1
LBIST clock divide ratio

register.description: Specifies the number of LBIST patterns to run.

bitfield.description: Number of stuck-at patterns to run
Number of set patterns to run
Number of reset patterns to run
Number of chain test patterns to run

register.description: Specifies the 32 LSBs of the PRPG seed.

bitfield.description: Initial seed for PRPG (bits 31:0)

register.description: Specifies the 21 MSBs of the PRPG seed.

bitfield.description: Initial seed for PRPG (bits 52:32)

register.description: Spare LBIST control bits.

bitfield.description: LBIST spare bits
PBIST isolation control
LBIST isolation control

register.description: Spare LBIST control bits.

bitfield.description: LBIST spare bits

register.description: Indicates LBIST status and provides MISR selection control.

bitfield.description: LBIST is done
LBIST is running
Selects source of LBIST output
Selects block of 32 MISR bits to read. A value of 0 selects a compacted 32-bit version of the full MISR. A value of 1-32 select a 32-bit segment of the MISR.

register.description: Contains LBIST MISR output value.

bitfield.description: 32-bits of MISR value selected by misr_mux_ctl

register.description: Contains expected MISR output value.

bitfield.description: MISR signature

register.description: Lower 32-bits of Partition3 write lock key. This register must be written with the designated key value followed by a write to with its key value before write-protected Partition 3 registers can be written.

bitfield.description: Write the kick0 unlock value followed by the kick1 unlock value to unlock the write-protected Partition3 registers
Unlock status. When set indicates that the proper unlock sequence has been performed and the partition is unlocked for writing.

register.description: Upper 32-bits of Partition 3 write lock key. This register must be written with the designated key value after a write to with its key value before write-protected Partition 3 registers can be written.

bitfield.description: Write the kick1 unlock value after the kick0 unlock value to unlock the write-protected Partition3 registers
